thread.title: Tuesday’s Travel News: Airbnb Offer in Cuba; Faster Wi-Fi in the Air
thread.title_full: Tuesday’s Travel News: Airbnb Offer in Cuba; Faster Wi-Fi in the Air - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Tuesday’s Travel News: Airbnb Offer in Cuba; Faster Wi-Fi in the Air
text:
Our weekday morning digest that includes consumer news, deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
AIRBNB OFFERS FREE CUBA VISITS
To celebrate the reopening of the United States embassy in Havana after more than a half-century of hostility, Airbnb is picking up the tab for United States travelers booked to stay in Cuba this week. Airbnb started its service in Cuba in April after the United States loosened traveling restrictions on the island and said it already had 2,000 homes listed there. The company said it is supporting the country’s tradition of private home-stays known as “casas particulares.” The refund will apply to any licensed U.S. traveler booked to stay in an Airbnb home on any date between Monday July 20 and Sunday July 26.
